SEARCH
Package pl.polsl.mostowska.integrationwebapp.model

Class IntegrationModel

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.mostowska.integrationwebapp.model.IntegrationModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
Rectangle, Trapezoid
public abstract class IntegrationModel extends Object
Abstract class modeling the process of numerical integration. This class provides a framework for implementing various numerical integration methods, such as the trapezoidal rule or Simpson's rule. It manages integration parameters, the function to be integrated, and intermediate results. Subclasses must provide a specific implementation for the `calculate()` method. The class utilizes Lombok annotations to automatically generate boilerplate code like getters, setters, and constructors.
Version:
3.0
Author:
Wiktoria Mostowska

    • calculate

      public abstract double calculate()
      Abstract method to calculate the integral. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the specific integration logic.
      Returns:
      The calculated integral value.

    • evaluateFunction

      protected double evaluateFunction(double x)
      Evaluates the mathematical function at a given point. This method checks if a function is set, and throws an exception if no function is selected.
      Parameters:
      x - The input value.
      Returns:
      The value of the function evaluated at x.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no function is set.
